column4: how can i specify the location where my ssh keys should be created... i thought it was ssh-key -f filename
.. ? no... why do you think i am asking here...
According to the manual, the key file is the last parameter in several versions of the command. For some, -f gives the input keyfile, and for some -f the output.
I cannot tell you more until you tell me what you're trying to do.
Hmm, and you are asking this on #ubuntu because?
I cannot help with different versions of ssh-keygen. What OS is your client running?
is it possible to do ssh with just a password?
With a password, sure. Just ssh to the box: ssh person@place
Use this to see what is going on: ssh -vv person@site
Yes, the restriction was set by the root user at the other end.
